title: Vinnie Jones pays tribute to late wife Tanya on X Factor: Celebrity
text:
Vinnie Jones was able to hold back tears on Saturday as he paid tribute to his late wife Tanya.

Speaking in a pre-recorded video message before taking to The X Factor: Celebrity stage, the football player turned actor said he wanted to win to carry on Tanya’s legacy.

He said: ‘I will tell you why I am here, in all seriousness.

‘My wife, Tans, she was just like, ‘You have got to do it. Please do it.’ She loves the show.

‘Soon after Tanya passed I decided I’ve got to do it for her legacy and we will carry that legacy on.

‘In her name we will try and win this.’

Could we be looking at our winner? (Picture: Rex)

He added: ‘I saw the show last week and there are some good singers, oh my God. It’s a tough song. There’s a load of dancing and jumping about the stage.

‘Hopefully, I want to get people up.

‘The main thing overlooking me is Tans.’

Vinnie Jones held back tears (Picture: ITV)

In 2013, Jones revealed both he and Tanya had melanoma, the most serious type of skin cancer, and he was later given the all-clear.

Tanya had also been treated twice for cervical cancer and underwent a heart transplant at 21 following the birth of her daughter Kaley.

They discovered last Christmas Eve that the cancer had spread to her brain, but she pushed through the festive period while in pain for the benefit of friends and family.

Vinnie was at Tanya’s side when she died at their Los Angeles home in July.

Vinnie Jones and wife Tanya (Picture: Rex)

Judge Simon Cowell said Jones had a chance of winning the competition and praised him as ‘a hard man’ with a ‘soft inside’ after fans chanted his name following his performance of Everybody Needs Somebody by The Blues Brothers, securing a standing ovation from the audience.

Former Pussycat Doll singer Nicole Scherzinger added: ‘Vinnie, you really know how to get the people going. Full throttle all the way.’
